issue.title: Empty message types caused by `Entity::Fini()` calling `Node::Fini()`

content.raw:
I just saw this issue. Some changes were made in pull request #2263:

1. `Entity::~Entity` calls `Entity::Fini` and nothing else.

1. `Entity::Fini` resets publishers and subscribers, and then calls `Node::Fini`, only if the node hasn't been reset yet. (Fini can be called multiple times)

These were based on [this](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/pull-requests/30/smart-pointers-in-gazebo-physics-world/diff) design document (which is under development). This is an attempt to clean up smart pointers in the least intrusive way for now while we work on a more elegant solution which would probably break API.

Let me know what you think and whether this solves your issue.
